channel.title: tips on Alok's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in tips on Alok's Blog

item.title: Git Commands
item.description: –tags: Useful Commands git add : tracking with git git status : current status of tracked, untracked, changed, committed files. git add filename.extension (only after making the file it can be done) double add command - stages the new changes git commit git add . -> all files are committed git add *.html ->only html files are committed

item.title: Emacs Shortcuts
item.description: Emacs Shortcuts Spc f d –> search for files in dired Spc : –> main command Spc g s –> git status Spc n n –> Capture template Spc n a –> agenda view Vim commands Ctrl up , down –> go up and down in file q [a-z] –> record a macro Shift » –> indent in code Evil snipe: s ch : go to ch ; same as f but more letters gc : to comment using evil gs [annotation] –> to go to lines directly like vimium ease dii –> delete inside indentation dik –> delete inside plus a line above Backlinks Emacs Hugo Blogging

item.title: Numpy
item.description: Working with numpy: import numpy as np a = np.array([0,1,2]) a.ndim - gives dimension of array a.shape : gives the shape of the array a.reshape((3,2)) new order of matrix to be formed changing a element of an array we reshaped is also going to change from the original since numpy package avoids copies so if copy needed: c= a.

item.title: Emacs Completion
item.description: Vim’s omni like completion Keybind Description C-x C-] Complete etags C-x C-f Complete file path C-x C-k Complete from dictionary/keyword C-x C-l Complete full line C-x C-o Invoke complete-at-point function C-x C-n Complete next symbol at point C-x C-p Complete previous symbol at point C-x C-s Complete snippet C-x s Complete spelling suggestions

item.title: Linux Tip
item.description: Additional features that come in handy: Bashrc : Notify when command completes control + a for getting to the start of the line and control + e to get to the end of the line sudo !! for last command with sudo priveleges last command with !$ yes | command_script_anything : for having not to say yes every time to a script filename : empty the contents of the file without deleting it or opening it

item.title: Python
item.description: – iteration: -! specific no of times: range(5) -! as long as the variable : for ch in “Hello” – querying the directory of the module for objects to use: e.g. import random dir(random) – asking for help with the object we searched: help(random.randint) – sleep function: import time time.sleep(5) – Know that everything is an object in python – Built in data structures: list, dictionary, tuple and sets -! lists are dynamic and mutable too.

item.title: Linux one liners
item.description: –tags: Useful Linux Packages sudo !! python -m SimpleHTTPServer :w !sudo tee % cd - ^foo^bar mtr google.com cp filename{,.bak} ctrl-x e $ssh-copy-id user@host > file.txt <space>command ffmpeg -f x11grab -s wxga -r 25 -i :0.0 -sameq /tmp/out.mpg reset ssh -N -L2001:localhost:80 somemachine echo "ls -l" | at midnight dig +short txt <keyword>.wp.dg.cx mount | column -t curl -u user:pass -d status="Tweeting from the shell" http://twitter.com/statuses/update.xml 'ALT+.' or '<ESC> .' dd if=/dev/dsp | ssh -c arcfour -C username@host dd of=/dev/dsp netstat -tlnp mount -t tmpfs tmpfs /mnt -o size=1024m sshfs name@server:/path/to/folder /path/to/mount/point !

item.title: Photoshop
item.description: Photoshop carefulness: Active layer is to be cared. Not on bed or something control +g go back move tool by pressing V always group layers and rename them control g for group after selecting using control Never use yellow background with white text Designing a cursor to appear on the design . Selecting a hover to other text color and also the opacity to change either low or high

item.title: Tmux
item.description: mastering tmux: tmux new -s “session_name” tmux ls - lists sessions Pane controls: everything is with control + B then: " : split horizontally % : split vertically o : go to next pane ; : previous pane q : show pane numbers z : toggle pane zoom ( can hide all panes using z) ! : convert pane into an window Control + O : swap panes t: copy mode
